unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Concerns Rise in Garment Export Sector**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Concerns Rise in Garment Export Sector**

unnormalised: Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu – Concerns are mounting regarding quality control procedures within the garment export sector. A recent audit by the Apparel Export Promotion Council (AEPC) revealed inconsistencies in fabric quality across several manufacturing units in the region.
normalised: Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu – Concerns are mounting regarding quality control procedures within the garment export sector. A recent audit by the Apparel Export Promotion Council (A E P C) revealed inconsistencies in fabric quality across several manufacturing units in the region.

unnormalised: Dr. Meena Sharma, head of the AEPC audit team, highlighted issues ranging from colourfastness discrepancies to variations in GSM (grams per square meter) across batches of cotton sourced for export orders destined for Europe and the US. One specific case involved a shipment of kurtis manufactured for a client in the UK, where the shrinkage rate exceeded acceptable limits.
normalised: Doctor Meena Sharma, head of the A E P C audit team, highlighted issues ranging from colourfastness discrepancies to variations in G S M (grams per square meter) across batches of cotton sourced for export orders destined for Europe and the U S. unnormalised: The potential financial impact is significant. Industry experts estimate that rejection of export orders due to substandard quality could cost the Tiruppur garment industry upwards of Rs. 500 crore annually. Many factories still rely on outdated manual inspection techniques in poorly lit 1000 sq ft spaces.
normalised: The potential financial impact is significant. Industry experts estimate that rejection of export orders due to substandard quality could cost the Tiruppur garment industry upwards of rupee five hundred crore annually. Many factories still rely on outdated manual inspection techniques in poorly lit one thousand square feet spaces.

unnormalised: Increased training and investment in modern quality control equipment are being advocated. The AEPC is proposing a collaborative initiative with the National Institute of Fashion Technology (NIFT) to provide specialized training to local workforce and modernize quality control processes. Further reviews are slated for next quarter.
